title: E89-1016

sentences.text: This paper presents a critical discussion of the various approaches that have been used in the evaluation of Natural Language systems .
We conclude that previous approaches have neglected to evaluate systems in the context of their use , e.g. solving a task requiring data retrieval .
This raises questions about the validity of such approaches .
In the second half of the paper , we report a laboratory study using the Wizard of Oz technique to identify NL requirements for carrying out this task .
We evaluate the demands that task dialogues collected using this technique , place upon a prototype Natural Language system .

We identify three important requirements which arose from the task that we gave our subjects : operators specific to the task of database access , complex contextual reference and reference to the structure of the information source .
We discuss how these might be satisfied by future Natural Language systems .

Entity-technique.label: technique
Entity-technique.description: The 'technique' refers to the Wizard of Oz technique used in a laboratory study to collect task dialogues for evaluating Natural Language system requirements.

Entity-the_second_half_of_the_paper.label: the second half of the paper
aliases: the second half of the paper
Entity-the_second_half_of_the_paper.description: The second half of the paper refers to the section where the authors present a laboratory study utilizing the Wizard of Oz technique to identify natural language requirements for a data retrieval task, along with an evaluation of the demands placed on a prototype Natural Language system.

mentions.local_name: the second half of the paper

Entity-this_task.label: this task
Entity-this_task.description: This task refers to the specific activity of data retrieval that is being evaluated in the context of Natural Language systems, as identified in a laboratory study using the Wizard of Oz technique.

Entity-this_paper.label: This paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper discusses the evaluation of Natural Language systems, highlighting shortcomings in previous approaches and presenting findings from a laboratory study on the requirements for effective task-oriented dialogues.

Entity-the_evaluation_of_natural_languag.label: the evaluation of Natural Language systems
aliases: the evaluation of Natural Language systems
Entity-the_evaluation_of_natural_languag.description: The evaluation of Natural Language systems refers to the assessment of different methodologies used to measure the effectiveness and performance of systems designed to understand and process human language, particularly in the context of their practical application in tasks such as data retrieval.

mentions.local_name: the evaluation of Natural Language systems

Entity-nl_requirement.label: NL requirements
Entity-nl_requirement.description: NL requirements refer to the specific needs and criteria identified through a laboratory study that are necessary for effectively utilizing Natural Language systems in the context of data retrieval tasks.

Entity-the_wizard_of_oz_technique.label: the Wizard of Oz technique
Entity-the_wizard_of_oz_technique.description: The Wizard of Oz technique is a research methodology used in user studies where participants interact with a system that they believe is autonomous, but is actually being operated or simulated by a human behind the scenes, allowing researchers to gather insights into user requirements and system interactions.

Entity-prototype_natural_language_system.label: prototype Natural Language system
Entity-prototype_natural_language_system.description: The prototype Natural Language system refers to a preliminary version of a software system designed to process and understand human language, which is being evaluated for its ability to meet specific requirements identified during a laboratory study focused on task dialogues for database access.

Entity-wizard_of_oz.label: Wizard of Oz
Entity-wizard_of_oz.description: The Wizard of Oz refers to a research technique in which a human operator simulates the behavior of a system to test user interactions and gather data on user requirements.

Entity-three_important_requirement.label: three important requirements
Entity-three_important_requirement.description: The term 'three important requirements' refers to the specific needs identified for a Natural Language system in the context of database access tasks, which include operators tailored for database interactions, the ability to handle complex contextual references, and the capability to reference the structure of the information source.

Entity-future_natural_language_system.label: future Natural Language systems
Entity-future_natural_language_system.description: Future Natural Language systems refer to advanced computational systems designed to effectively understand and process human language, particularly in the context of specific tasks such as data retrieval, while addressing identified requirements like task-specific operators and complex contextual references.

Entity-the_task_that_we_gave_our_subject.label: the task that we gave our subjects
aliases: the task that we gave our subjects
Entity-the_task_that_we_gave_our_subject.description: The task that we gave our subjects refers to a laboratory study focused on evaluating the requirements for natural language processing in the context of database access, which involved identifying specific operators, handling complex contextual references, and understanding the structure of the information source.

mentions.local_name: the task that we gave our subjects

Entity-a_task_requiring_data_retrieval.label: a task requiring data retrieval
Entity-a_task_requiring_data_retrieval.description: A task requiring data retrieval refers to the process of utilizing natural language systems to access and extract specific information from databases or information sources, highlighting the need for effective evaluation of these systems in practical contexts.

Entity-evaluation.label: evaluation
Entity-evaluation.description: The term 'evaluation' refers to the assessment of various approaches used to analyze the effectiveness and validity of Natural Language systems, particularly in the context of their practical application in tasks such as data retrieval.

Entity-the_various_approach.label: the various approaches
Entity-the_various_approach.description: The various approaches refer to the different methodologies and frameworks that have been employed to assess the effectiveness and performance of Natural Language systems.

Entity-requirement.label: requirements
Entity-requirement.description: The term 'requirements' refers to the essential criteria and specifications identified for a Natural Language system, specifically related to operators for database access, complex contextual references, and the structure of the information source, as derived from a laboratory study.

Entity-approach.label: approaches
Entity-approach.description: The term 'approaches' refers to the various methods and strategies previously employed in the evaluation of Natural Language systems, particularly those that have been criticized for not considering the practical context of their application.

Entity-a_laboratory_study.label: a laboratory study
Entity-a_laboratory_study.description: A laboratory study refers to a controlled research investigation conducted in a lab setting, utilizing the Wizard of Oz technique to explore and identify natural language requirements necessary for effective data retrieval tasks.

Entity-the_context_of_their_use.label: the context of their use
Entity-the_context_of_their_use.description: The term 'the context of their use' refers to the specific circumstances and practical scenarios in which Natural Language systems are applied, particularly in tasks such as data retrieval, highlighting the importance of evaluating these systems based on their real-world applications.

Entity-the_validity_of_such_approach.label: the validity of such approaches
Entity-the_validity_of_such_approach.description: The validity of such approaches refers to the reliability and appropriateness of previously used evaluation methods for Natural Language systems, particularly in their failure to consider the practical context of task execution.

Entity-system.label: systems
Entity-system.description: The term 'systems' refers to Natural Language systems that are evaluated in the context of their practical application, particularly in tasks involving data retrieval.

Entity-this.label: This
Entity-this.description: The term 'This' refers to the previously discussed neglect in evaluating Natural Language systems in the context of their practical use, particularly in relation to data retrieval tasks.

Entity-previous_approach.label: previous approaches
Entity-previous_approach.description: The term 'previous approaches' refers to earlier methodologies used in the evaluation of Natural Language systems that failed to consider the practical context of their application, particularly in tasks involving data retrieval.

Entity-natural_language_system.label: Natural Language systems
Entity-natural_language_system.description: Natural Language systems refer to computational systems designed to process, understand, and generate human language in a way that is meaningful and useful.

Entity-task_dialogue.label: task dialogues
Entity-task_dialogue.description: Task dialogues refer to structured interactions or conversations designed to accomplish specific tasks, particularly in the context of evaluating Natural Language systems for data retrieval and database access.

Entity-task.label: task
Entity-task.description: The 'task' refers to the specific activity of solving a data retrieval problem within the context of evaluating Natural Language systems.

Entity-validity.label: validity
Entity-validity.description: The term 'validity' in this context refers to the soundness and reliability of the evaluation approaches used for Natural Language systems, questioning whether they effectively assess the systems in real-world task scenarios.

Entity-complex_contextual_reference.label: complex contextual reference
Entity-complex_contextual_reference.description: The term 'complex contextual reference' refers to a specific requirement identified in the evaluation of Natural Language systems, highlighting the need for these systems to effectively manage and interpret intricate references within the context of data retrieval tasks.

Entity-a_critical_discussion.label: a critical discussion
Entity-a_critical_discussion.description: A critical discussion refers to a thorough examination and evaluation of the various methodologies employed in assessing Natural Language systems, highlighting their limitations and the need for context-aware evaluation.

Entity-reference_to_the_structure_of_the.label: reference to the structure of the information source
aliases: reference to the structure of the information source
Entity-reference_to_the_structure_of_the.description: The mention 'reference to the structure of the information source' refers to a specific requirement identified in the context of evaluating Natural Language systems, highlighting the need for systems to understand and utilize the organizational framework of the data they access during task-oriented dialogues.

mentions.local_name: reference to the structure of the information source

Entity-question.label: questions
Entity-question.description: The term 'questions' refers to inquiries regarding the validity of previous evaluation approaches used in Natural Language systems.

Entity-operator_specific_to_the_task_of_.label: operators specific to the task of database access
aliases: operators specific to the task of database access
Entity-operator_specific_to_the_task_of_.description: Operators specific to the task of database access refer to specialized functions or commands designed to facilitate the retrieval and manipulation of data within a database in the context of natural language processing tasks.

mentions.local_name: operators specific to the task of database access

Entity-structure_of_the_information_sour.label: structure of the information source
aliases: the structure of the information source
Entity-structure_of_the_information_sour.description: The 'structure of the information source' refers to the organizational framework and arrangement of data within a database that is essential for effective data retrieval and natural language processing in task-oriented dialogues.

mentions.local_name: the structure of the information source

Entity-data_retrieval.label: data retrieval
Entity-data_retrieval.description: Data retrieval is the process of obtaining information from a database or data source in response to a query or request.

Entity-database_access.label: database access
Entity-database_access.description: Database access refers to the process or task of retrieving, manipulating, and managing data stored in a database system.

Entity-laboratory_study.label: laboratory study
Entity-laboratory_study.description: A laboratory study is a controlled research investigation conducted in a lab setting to explore specific hypotheses or phenomena, often involving experiments and systematic observation.

Entity-paper.label: paper
Entity-paper.description: A paper is a written document that presents research findings, analyses, or discussions on a specific topic, typically in an academic or scholarly context.

summary: This paper presents a critical discussion of the various approaches that have been used in the evaluation of Natural Language systems . We conclude that previous approaches have neglected to evaluate systems in the context of their use , e.g. solving a task requiring data retrieval . This raises questions about the validity of such approaches . In the second half of the paper , we report a laboratory study using the Wizard of Oz technique to identify NL requirements for carrying out this task . We evaluate the demands that task dialogues collected using this technique , place upon a prototype Natural Language system . We identify three important requirements which arose from the task that we gave our subjects : operators specific to the task of database access , complex contextual reference and reference to the structure of the information source . We discuss how these might be satisfied by future Natural Language systems .

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates an action where the subject introduces, displays, or offers information, ideas, or arguments to the audience or reader, represented by the object. It implies a formal or structured delivery of content, often with the intention of informing, persuading, or engaging the audience.

Predicate-of.label: of
Predicate-of.description: The predicate 'of' serves to establish a relationship of association or belonging between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject is characterized by, related to, or concerned with the object, often implying a context or a specific focus that the subject addresses or encompasses.

Predicate-used_in.label: used in
Predicate-used_in.description: The predicate 'used in' indicates a functional relationship where the subject is applied or utilized within the context or framework of the object. It signifies that the subject serves a purpose or plays a role in the processes, activities, or methodologies described by the object.

Predicate-have_been_used_in.label: have been used in
Predicate-have_been_used_in.description: The predicate 'have been used in' indicates that the subject has been employed or applied within the context of the object. It suggests a functional relationship where the subject contributes to or plays a role in the processes, activities, or contexts described by the object. This predicate often implies a historical or ongoing relevance of the subject in relation to the object.

Predicate-neglected_to_evaluate.label: neglected to evaluate
Predicate-neglected_to_evaluate.description: The predicate 'neglected to evaluate' indicates a failure or oversight by the subject to assess or consider the object. It implies that the subject, which may represent a theory, method, or entity, did not undertake the necessary analysis or examination of the object, which could be a concept, system, or phenomenon. This neglect suggests a gap in understanding or a lack of thoroughness in the subject's approach, potentially leading to incomplete conclusions or missed opportunities for improvement.

Predicate-in_the_context_of.label: in the context of
Predicate-in_the_context_of.description: The predicate 'in the context of' establishes a relationship that situates the subject within a specific framework or environment defined by the object. It implies that the understanding, interpretation, or relevance of the subject is influenced or determined by the conditions, circumstances, or parameters represented by the object.

Predicate-requiring.label: requiring
Predicate-requiring.description: The predicate 'requiring' establishes a relationship where the subject necessitates or demands the object as a condition for its completion or execution. It indicates that the subject cannot be fulfilled or achieved without the presence or involvement of the object.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' serves as a linking verb that establishes an identity or equivalence between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject possesses the qualities or characteristics described by the object, effectively defining or categorizing the subject within a certain context.

Predicate-raises.label: raises
Predicate-raises.description: The predicate 'raises' indicates an action or process by which the subject brings attention to, increases the prominence of, or generates a particular state or condition in the object. It suggests that the subject is actively contributing to the emergence or elevation of the object, often implying a sense of inquiry, concern, or consideration related to the object.

Predicate-about.label: about
Predicate-about.description: The predicate 'about' serves to establish a relationship of relevance or focus between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject pertains to, concerns, or is related to the information or topic represented by the object. It connects the two elements by suggesting that the subject is seeking to explore, inquire, or express something regarding the object.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates that the subject employs or utilizes the object as a means to achieve a specific purpose or outcome. It establishes a functional relationship where the subject actively incorporates the object into its processes or activities.

Predicate-identifies.label: identifies
Predicate-identifies.description: The predicate 'identifies' denotes a relationship in which the subject is capable of recognizing, determining, or establishing the existence or characteristics of the object. It implies a process of discernment or classification where the subject reveals or points out specific attributes, categories, or elements associated with the object.

Predicate-for_carrying_out.label: for carrying out
Predicate-for_carrying_out.description: The predicate 'for carrying out' indicates a purpose or intention behind the subject's action or capability, linking the subject to the object by expressing that the subject is intended or designed to facilitate the execution or completion of the object.

Predicate-is_used_to_identify.label: is used to identify
Predicate-is_used_to_identify.description: The predicate 'is used to identify' establishes a functional relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject serves a purpose or function in recognizing, determining, or clarifying the characteristics or nature of the object. It implies that the subject is a tool, method, or process that aids in the identification of the object, facilitating understanding or analysis in a specific context.

Predicate-place_upon.label: place upon
Predicate-place_upon.description: The predicate 'place upon' indicates an action where the subject is positioned or assigned in relation to the object, suggesting a transfer of responsibility, focus, or emphasis. It implies that the subject is being set in a context or framework defined by the object, often involving a hierarchical or foundational relationship.

Predicate-collected_using.label: collected using
Predicate-collected_using.description: The predicate 'collected using' establishes a relationship between the subject and the object by indicating the method or approach employed to gather or obtain the subject. It implies that the subject, which represents a set of data or information, was acquired through the application of the object, which denotes a specific technique, tool, or process utilized in the collection effort.

Predicate-arose_from.label: arose from
Predicate-arose_from.description: The predicate 'arose from' indicates a causal or originating relationship between the subject and the object, suggesting that the subject is a result or consequence of the conditions, actions, or circumstances represented by the object.

Predicate-include.label: include
Predicate-include.description: The predicate 'include' establishes a relationship where the subject encompasses or contains the object as a part of its overall composition or scope. It indicates that the object is a component, element, or feature that is integrated within the subject, thereby contributing to its definition or functionality.

Predicate-refers_to.label: refers to
Predicate-refers_to.description: The predicate 'refers to' establishes a relationship where the subject denotes, indicates, or points to the object, suggesting that the subject is a representation or mention of the object in some context. This connection implies that the subject provides information or context that is relevant to understanding or identifying the object.

Predicate-satisfied_by.label: satisfied by
Predicate-satisfied_by.description: The predicate 'satisfied by' indicates a relationship where the subject is fulfilled, content, or meets the expectations set by the object. It suggests that the qualities, characteristics, or functionalities of the object provide a sense of completion or approval to the subject.

Predicate-requires.label: requires
Predicate-requires.description: The predicate 'requires' establishes a relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject has a necessity or dependence on the object for its completion, execution, or fulfillment. It implies that the object is essential or needed in some capacity for the subject to achieve its intended purpose or function.

Predicate-utilizes.label: utilizes
Predicate-utilizes.description: The predicate 'utilizes' indicates that the subject employs or makes use of the object in a practical or functional manner. It suggests an active engagement where the subject applies the object to achieve a specific purpose or outcome.

Predicate-is_used_to_evaluate.label: is used to evaluate
Predicate-is_used_to_evaluate.description: The predicate 'is used to evaluate' establishes a relationship where the subject is a method, tool, or approach that serves the purpose of assessing, measuring, or determining the quality, effectiveness, or performance of the object. It indicates that the subject plays a functional role in the process of evaluation concerning the object.

Predicate-report.label: report
Predicate-report.description: The predicate 'report' indicates that the subject is providing information, findings, or an account regarding the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject conveys details or results related to the object, often in a formal or structured manner.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a more specific instance or category that falls under the wider category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a larger scope or set of concepts that includes the subject, thereby providing a context in which the subject can be understood as a subset of the broader category.
